results.title: Pilkington Brothers offer: the best of both worlds
results.creator_credit: Frank Worth, Cecil Musk and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Two visitors from outer space visit Earth in order to investigate a material unknown on their planet - glass. They are shown the many architectural uses of glass and the many varieties which are available for use.

results.title: Ram sales
results.brief_description: This is a general interest film which shows typical scenes at the annual Sydney sheep show, including judging. It also illustrates the different areas of country in relation to ram types, and shows various wool fabrics and types of wool from which fabrics are manufactured. Photography by Tom Price and commentary by Wilfred Thomas.

results.title: RAAF Newsreel. No. 9. Operation sabre ferry
results.creator_credit: Harry Rayner and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force
results.brief_description: Newsreel items including: 1. No. 3 Squadron and No. 77 Squadron of the RAAF ferry the Sabre Jet from the east coast of Australia to Butterworth in Malaya via Townsville, Darwin, Netherlands New Guinea, Philippines, Borneo, Malaya. 2. Firefighter - RAAF demonstrates capability of new firefighting truck. 3. Addition of the new Air to Air Missile to the Sabre Jet Fighter. Test fired at Woomera.

results.title: Service to the inland (A)
results.creator_credit: J. Campbell Dobbie and Peerless Films
results.brief_description: A story of the inland telegraph, demonstrating the need for and efficiency of the inland communications system. Shows a message from a Northern Territory bush wireless to Dunlop Tyres translated into a narrative about developments in the outback (transportation, primary industry, the flying doctor etc.). Also includes footage of Aboriginal couriers travelling overland on foot, Aboriginal settlements, their culture, cooking, food gathering etc, in particular Emily’s Gap.

results.title: Private eye
results.creator_credit: Peter McKinley, Tasmania Dept. of Labour and Industry and Tasfilm Productions
results.brief_description:
This 1970 film demonstrates the importance of eye safety and shows various methods of protection. The film opens with a sequence in film noir style of a ‘private eye’ working a case, with this gimmick interspersed throughout the film. It shows industrial working scenarios and various examples of eye protection, including safety glasses and helmets with visors.

Produced by Tasfilm Productions for the Department of Labour and Industry, Tasmania, and presented by Protector Sureguard.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Shadow on the reef. Turning turtle.
results.creator_credit: Richard Dennison, ABC-TV (Australia), National Geographic Society and Orana Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Blue wilderness”.
“Shadow on the reef” looks at the incredible Whale Shark, the world’s largest shark. Valerie and Ron Taylor explore the wonders of the deep below the coral reef, emphasising the message that this fragile ecology is increasingly under threat.
“Turning Turtle” sees Ron and Valerie Taylor at odds with the Queensland Government over the fate of turtles on coral islands, with a focus on Raine Island. The Green Turtles are a rare and ancient species and the fight to save them pits the Taylors against bureaucracy and harsh physical conditions.

results.title: Professional Development
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Institute of Educational Administration
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Case studies in effective schooling”.
Case studiesin effective schooling presents first hand accounts of how individual schools have gone about improving their effectiveness. “Professional development” is the second part in the series and records the manner in which Ivanhoe East Primary School supports its educational program with a coherent, planned program of professional development for its staff.
